comments:
ESE 215 focuses on common principles of Circuits, Systems and flows of electron, photons, and other entities as applied to electrical, and non- electrical systems such as optical (plasmonic), fluidic, traffic, neural, electrochemical, and biological circuits. 

Students generally found the course to be a “good class” and reported that it “got more interesting as time went on.” The only complaint that one student had was that the “last few weeks of class…felt very rushed.” Other than that, the course was highly regarded by most students.

Professor Lee was highly regarded by his students. Students reported him as being “great,” an “excellent professor,” and an “awesome lecturer.” Many students found that Professor Lee made “the difficult material presented in this course very easy to understand” and that he explained the material “exceedingly clearly.”

The class generally consisted of undergraduates between freshman and junior year. Students found that “the homework and exams were of reasonable difficulty.” No excessive workload was reported.
